website_summaries.verdict: A powerful deluxe fan you can personalize.
pros: Includes fans for case, CPU, and GPU cooling
Motherboard-powered fans put out 72 CFM and operate at 1,000-2,000 RPM
Each has RGB features including 6 controller-adjusted colors and 10 light effect modes
Fans themselves are 3-pin, but they offer intelligent speed controls and can be improved with 4-pin adapters
cons: Fans are a bit loud, and some users find the RGB controller difficult to set up

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality fans. Carefully manufactured with fine details and attention to the design. LEDs are bright and add cool effect to the general look. I also use LED control module to test my other LED strips while working on my other DIY projects (see video attached). It does worth its price and could be a good gift to a person who is into computers or electronic projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great Fans For A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Fans were super easy to install, didn’t even need to use the Gigabyte adapter on my AORUS B450 Elite. I also like that the hub for the RGB headers doesn’t need SATA power like other hubs I’ve installed before in computers. The lights look great as well, and all of the effects worked flawlessly with RGB Fusion. I am using the fans for exhaust and the airflow inside my case is really nice with these installed. I would definitely recommend these for anyone trying to add more RGB into their setup while also looking for an affordable cooling solution.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Sypniewski

customer_reviews.title: Honestly a shocker!
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with the first ones i got , none of my boards had the new 3 pin ARGB . But the older 4 pin, i ordered them again and used the controller that was included .This fans are so good the only thing that doesnt make them perfect is the fact that they dont come on 140mm. As long as i got a chance i will be buying this fans . I have nothing bot noctua on my main build ! if this came at 140mm ...i would replace all of my noctua fans in a heartbeat . The quality and performance is astonishing ! 5/5 perfect fans
customer_reviews.author: Carlos O Otero Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great looking and great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at these. These are as quiet as bequiet silentwings, in fact with my pc sitting right next to me I have to double check to see if they are spinning. My only minor knock is that they dont sit flat against the raidiator frame which will effect some of the air movement at higher speeds. So far that hasnt been much of a problem. Seriously dont think that these are just another cheap chinese fan, these perform better and quieter to my ek varder that they are replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Non standard ARGB connectors...
customer_reviews.text: These fans are excellent quality for the cost. Though I'm not thrilled with the 5 volt 4-pin ARGB connectors which essentially force you to use the included proprietary ARGB controller. I would have much preferred these fans had the standard 5 volt 3-pin ARGB connectors so that I could use the controller included with my PC case. Needless to say I was able to improvise to get everything wired up and working properly. I'm deducting a star for the non standard ARGB connectors. I can only imagine the confusion this causes new people when trying to differentiate between ARGB (3-pin) vs RGB (4-pin) connections.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: These fans are very loud which I did not expect them to produce so much noise. They were easy to install into my case but figuring out the wiring was awful and the instructions were terrible. After spending hours trying to figure it out how to hook these up I still can’t get them to work with mystic light or adjust the speed of the fan automatically. Maybe these would be better for someone more experienced with installing these but for a beginner these were very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: Great fans, but 12v LED conversion didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I planned my build around these fans utilizing the 12v 4 pin input (comes with the 5 packs of fans), but the motherboard could not correctly utilize them when I did, the colors would flash in and out and it was a hot mess. I bought a splitter for my 5V 3 pin LED header and then these worked perfect, so just plan to only use these with 3 pin. The fans are very quiet, and the best part is they look great used as intake or exhaust. The LED rings look great without being overpowering. I have 9 of these in my system now.
customer_reviews.author: WWJDualWield

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a pack of 3 after watching a review on YouTube, and they've been great. The housing feels dense and rigid, the lights are bright and the colors are surprisingly accurate, not washed out or anything. The fans are quiet, even under a high load, and for the money they can't be beat. The only real downside (though it's entirely unavoidable, so no real issue with these fans in particular) is that two cables per fan (RGB + power) starts to add up in a hurry, so you'll need a good place to cable manage.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I was looking for a rgb fan that was more subdued accent and less of a giant light in my case. These are fantastic. They are 4 pin rgb connections so you can mod them into other controllers or you can add them right into most motherboards with an rgb header and control them with your MB. They cheap remote is well, cheap. But the computer I have these on now has now rgb header so its nice to have. The preloaded effects are decent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could’ve kept these
customer_reviews.text: I was exited to get these fans. The fans are definitely good quality and thick. I was able to set the lighting but only able to power one. I’m not sure it has something to do with my motherboard, but I was disappointed. The lightening was fantastic, and the fan blew out hard with no noise. I wish I could’ve kept these. I decided to buy a new tower with built in fans instead. If your motherboard supports these lights and your tower is big enough, I’d recommend you get these for sure. Side note: the box was completely damaged. It looked like it was used already.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: High quality fans at a lower cost!
customer_reviews.text: The fans feel like a very high-quality, but I only gave a four-star because where the fan connectors are at feels more like a low to medium quality. Three different fan speeds that you can select manually if you cannot connect this to your motherboard. Currently using on board graphics till I can get isopropyl to clean the gpu and reset the heatsink for it later today. Can’t wait to get the rest of my new parts for an entirely new computer so I can connect to the motherboard too and sync everything at once.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: These work wonderfully, but...
customer_reviews.text: These worked wonderfully for me. The instructions weren't extremely clear, but it could just be that it's been almost a decade since my last build. One thing I do have to warn against is that the connector cables were a but loose and that sometimes cause the fans to easily shut off if the cables moved. This issue went away once you get the cables locked down, but it was a bit of a pain to get it in the right position and having the pins contacted properly to power the fan. Once installed, I haven't had any issues yet. Update: The LEDs on one of the fans kind of just died out.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality for the Price, Comparable to Noctua (for sound and temps)
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed on the Quality, Sound, Airflow and temps that these three Addressable RGB fans for $35 was. The sound and airflow along with temps are compatible to Noctua within 1-3Deg Celsius, and within a couple Decibels (2) for sound. They Will work With MSI Mystic light ( my current set up on an x470 Gaming pro Carbon) But chose not to, due to Mystic lights limited options for effects. The build Quality Feels and looks nice, you ARE able to tell that they are a little less expensive when you look at the side of the fans where it was " molded" but other than that the lights are defused enough so it looks nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Garon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fans plus quiet too!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality fans and quiet with unreal lighting choices! Not huge into the wired remote however you can control three things, light mode, color mode & fan speed. When plugging the fan splitter into mobo directly YOU MIGHT have to control fan speed through the bios. Not a biggie for me. If they do come out with a newer model i would recommend even more color modes :) & a wireless remote (i would pay xtra for those) In closing the best RGB fan-kit i have ever own! take your time much cable management..but easy to do! If you love RGB and need x3 120mm fans an absolute MUST HAVE....all for a SUB 40 price point!!
customer_reviews.author: sjs137

customer_reviews.title: Little Flash, Some Noise
customer_reviews.text: Noise levels could use some work on this. The RGB features are also pretty lackluster as I've only been able to find a 'spinning' option. Set up was slightly unclear with the way the cables were labeled. Maybe if you have put together a PC or two before you'll have an easier understanding of what goes what and where. Not the worst set of instructions I've gotten though that's for sure. For the price, though, I'm pretty happy. My PC temps have definitely went down, at least when idle, and I chalk that up to the new fans. I have replaced all of my old case fans with these, and it made a noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rindfuss

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with Tomahawk Max without controller
customer_reviews.text: It's so sad, these fans come with everything. I can't seem to figure out why they wouldn't come with a 4 pin adaptor which my motherboard has. If you have a 3 pin rgb then you are good, if you have 4 pin then you have to use their horrible controller. If they just had an adatpor I could use them on my Tomahawk Max without a problem. Instead these fans that are probably closer to a 3 or 4 are only rated a 1 for me. Sad, I'll either have to return them or find some that fit a 4 pin.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Great for budget builds
customer_reviews.text: The fans are build on high quality materials which you can easily feel on hands. The fans feel very study. Each fan has two braided cables for power and rgbs, the box included the splitters for the power and the rgb as well which is a huge plus for those motherboards that have limited RGB and Fan headers. I will recommend this product for those who are looking to do a budget build with quality components but do not care about branding The down side of these fans is the manual came with is really confusing and almost impossible to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Van

customer_reviews.title: Love These Fans!
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 3 of the three pack of these fans. I am very happy with them. I am using 6 of them in my current build, 3 intake and 3 exhaust. Low noise, decent air flow and great colors. The fan quality seems very good. I can not comment on the controller since I have them connected to my motherboard for speed and lighting control. I'm using an MSI board by the way, and use the Dragon software for the lighting. Not great software but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing RGB, great airflow
customer_reviews.text: The lighting on these fans are stunning. The lighting effects work great with the addressable LEDs. Setup with my motherboard RGB control is quick and easy. I've had magnetic levitation fans before, and they weren't as quiet as those top tier fans at the same speeds, but taking it down 200 RPM or so to around 1000 RPM makes them nearly silent, and completely silent with my headset on. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find fans that are cheap, have RGB, and are PWM. These ones do. Installation was not difficult. No harder than any other fans. My motherboard didn't have an RGB header on it, so I had to use the included RGB controller. My only complaint about this is that the RGB controller uses molex power, which means I had to go find my power supply cables and plug one in. I wish it used SATA power, as it's more commonplace these days. Still, I don't mind it because it works well. Plenty of modes to choose from. Great option if you want to add some color and light to your PC and cool it at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Young

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: 7-month update: I still like these fans. But if you care about quiet fans these aren’t the ones. They aren’t loud, but I find the sound impossible to ignore even when my PC is idling. It’s soft and not very high pitched, so some may be able to easily ignore it. Just know it’s there, always there. Have no complaints about these fans. They look great, haven't made much noise (had them a month and sit about 18 inches from them). I'm very happy with my purchase. Props to @bitwit for the recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: JM125

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB fans, works with Gigabyte RGBFusion!
customer_reviews.text: It has bright led and works perfectly with Gigabyte RGBfusion. I can control brightness, speed and color. To have full control through RGBFusion, motherboard must have 5v 3pin addressable RGB header not 12v 4pin header. It is loud at max RPM so you have to run it at slower speed. I run these fan at 1000rpm, it is whisper quiet and moves decent amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: JK35

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Update * customer service with PCcooler contacted me and arranged to correct the issue with my bad fans. the replacements work as expected and I am very happy to recommend them as a great budget option that really feels like a premium product. thanks !! Mine arrived and the build quality looks great. All fans work and are really pretty quiet. 2 of the 5 fans leds blipped on but quit within 15 minutes and no longer work. I unplugged them and moved ports still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, you can not beat these fans for this price. They feel and look like they are worth more, the quality is really great! The company that puts the fans together even went the extra mile to put plastic caps on the pins to avoid damage that not even more pricey Thermaltek fans I have purchased before provided. I thought that was very impressive. I love these fans. So far they're quiet and look way nicer than a lot of the other more costly fans I have had. Would purchase (and probably will) again!
customer_reviews.author: Celestial

customer_reviews.title: Best 120mm fan I've owned
customer_reviews.text: These are easally the best rgb fans ive ever had. Uphere and asiahorse brands are simpler but dont have any fan speed controll. So when overclocking temps get higher then they should. These fans however work amazing and look good too
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: no asus arua sync and one fan wasn't working
customer_reviews.text: Asus aura has a 4 pin connector my cooler master case with fans has 4 pin connectors for rgb. Yet this comes with a 3 pin connector with no adapter for a 4 pin just another gigabyte 3 pin adapter. So can't use asus aura on it. On top of that one fan rgb is dead and won't turn on. Should give it 1 star but the ones that do work look nice. Update. The people at pccooler have been super responsive and have sent me a replacement and as far as the aura sync issue I believe this has more to do with asus than it does pccooler. So I am revising my review.
customer_reviews.author: Han Choi

customer_reviews.title: about as close to perfect as you can get at this price
customer_reviews.text: my only real complaint is that they're not dimmable via MSI mystic light. I know they will dim since one of the preset options is a solid color dimming cycle, but mystic light won't dim them. other than that they're very high quality and I have no complaints. something to note is that the cables are quite long. this is handy at times, but a nuisance when you've already got 6 hard drives worth of cables snaking all along the back panel.
customer_reviews.author: C. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent RGB system fans with Remote
customer_reviews.text: Short and simple review: it works out of the box. The RGB is clean and vibrant and illuminating on both sides of the fan. The remote control also works great and you can switch the fans from remote fan speeds to pwm with remote which is awesome as well as adjust colors. Only issue i had was the fan power cables were very short so the fan and rgb hub had to be installed pretty high up in the PC Case instead below with the PSU. Could.be fixed with extension cables but cable management is difficult with thick cables.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Fan mad high pitched hum when RGB was on
customer_reviews.text: As a standalone fan, it works great, it can move a lot of air. However, I did not buy these to be a standalone fan. I may just be stupid (that's probably the case), but after looking everything up correctly, and testing each fan 1 at a time, plugging them into the RGB header on my MOBO, each fan would flash RGB for about 2-3 seconds while making the humming sound and then shortly after the RGB section would pop and the lights would go out.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price! Fans feel very robust. I spent a good amount of time trying to figure out which cables enable rgb on my motherboard, wish instructions were a little bit clearer. However, it all fits and works fine. Cables are braided, looks way better that way. I couldn't find a way to make the hub look tidy in my case, but it's in the back so it's not a big deal. Overall, I get a nice looking build now for under $60. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Timur

customer_reviews.title: You don't need RGB headers on your motherboard for these fans.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the five pack of fans and I was glad to see that they sell this with an RGB control box. What I did notice is that they want you to plug the fans into a CPU fan port but any fan header will work. The fans do not feel cheap and are similar to some of the big box competitors. The RGB is a ring on the outsides of the fan. Overall I am really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton West

customer_reviews.title: Great, nice looking, quiet, efficient fans at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome. So while building my pc, I noticed the fan that came with the case was just not doing the job. I wanted some flare and performance so I went with these. I am glad I did. The fans push a lot of air, and keep my pc cool. It's easy to setup, and they look awesome. And, as a cherry on top, the fans are quiet and while playing csgo with no volume, the fans could barely be heard.
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Need more clear instructions
customer_reviews.text: After figuring out how to make it work with my motherboard(msi x399 carbon gaming) finally made it work. my mobo has 2 headers. 1 for the 12v(4-pin) and jrainbow 4 pin connector. The cable that came with it for the 5v header won't work. With MSI Mystic light program the effects was not really that good. especially with breathing and steady modes. the effect are not that smooth. lights are flickering but not with the manual mode though. But overall, quality is very good. Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: joevir

customer_reviews.title: These little fellas are stellar
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have any cons. I have a minor issue which may have been self inflicted. The connection via the pins is loose which may have been from closing my back case door. I will say they sync with other manufacturer's which solved my loose pin issue. There quiet slick and very bright. I'd buy again and most likely will add in the future. Photos in the reviews do more justice for a solid conviction on pulling the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Kollin

customer_reviews.title: Great PWM RGB Fan Set
customer_reviews.text: This PCCooler Moonlight 5 in 1 kit is the first thing you see when my computer turns on. They light al the inside of my computer case, and the best of all they keep my computer cool. The only thing it is a little bit akward about this kit is the cable management, but I think there is no other way. Once you work out your way through all those cables, they just are great. I have some photos, but you can't see how great they look.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble installing these at first, but with a little trial an error I figured it out. If you end up with a lights not working or fans not spinning just make sure to undo the plugs and try plugging them in upside-down. I thought I had them in right but I tried that and it worked. It looks really nice in the end, the fans can get pretty loud, but it's like a white noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Tyler Sartin

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool...
customer_reviews.text: RGB cables become disconnected rather easily, also I need to buy extensions for the three fans I am using, can't use these fans with my touch screen fan controller as they are 4 pin and the controller only accepts 3 pin fans. Other than thatn they really dress up the PC. You do need to be conscious of cable management on these because internal grills will really detract from the appearance on the inside of your case... and cables could be caught in the blades so they need to be managed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisCrystalize

customer_reviews.title: Probably the cheapest high quality fan
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything about the actual performance of the fan because I've never owned good fans before, but it's one of the cheapest RGB fans that actually connect to your Mobo and can be automatically controlled. You're not forced to use a dumb proprietary fan interface that if it breaks, your fans are basically worthless which is what happened with my previous set of chinese RGB fans.
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: Good value and good looks.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the fans seem well-made. Nice, soft touch plastic, rubber dampers around the screw mounts, sleeved cables and included accessories were all a nice touch and really add to the value of these fans. One area to improve is marking on the fan itself or writing somewhere in the manual which direction the airflow is, cause I didn't see it anywhere and I definitely got it wrong the first time. Noise levels are decent and comparable to other, more expensive fans. The lighting is very classy with lots of built-in effects if you use the included controller/hub too. I'll likely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Fetherolf

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but some syncing issues
customer_reviews.text: Great overall product, the only issue I have with these fans is syncing breathing and flashing effects to my motherboard (msi b450 tomahawk max). Pre-installed color effects and syncing static effects are seamless and vibrant, but as soon as I try to do a flashing(cycle) or breathing(cycle), the lights start to flicker uncontrollably and sometimes even flash random colors. Not completely sure if this a motherboard, software, or product issue or not, but that's my only gripe. Noise levels are fine for my, and the lighting is nice and vibrant without being too in your face. So if the above issue isn't a bother or if you plan on stayi g with solid colors, definitely pick these up.
customer_reviews.author: David Reed

customer_reviews.title: I'm very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a set of fans to help cool my case down a bit. I came across these and was a little skeptical because of the cheap price and unknown brand, but I decided to give it try and I'm glad I did. The fan nosie of all three is the same as my one single stock fan. The colors are bright and stunning. I have a older motherboard and it only has a plug for one system fan, but these fans come with a adapter to run all three on one port. I would definitely recommend these on a budget built!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Holsey

customer_reviews.title: It works on AORUS
customer_reviews.text: Gigabyte AORUS B450 WIFI. I looked on YouTube and Amazon at a few 120mm case fans and this one really caught my eye. It had all the needed wiring for the motherboard hook up or a stand alone controller. Since my MB has RGB Fusion 2.0. I hoped it work with the lights. because I wanted a case fan that would match the AMD halo heat sink fan LED. For me the fans run faster than my stock ones, quite, very good quality build. and at a lower price point than the bigger brand names one.
customer_reviews.author: Boxx

customer_reviews.title: Great Fans and love the RGB LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I installed these fans when I upgraded my PC. the colors are nice and bright and the fans are pretty quiet. Be sure that the motherboard that you are putting them on has a 3 pin header. That is something I learned when looking into LED fans.. Having 3 pins is better than 4.. It was pretty easy to install and to get working.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N (Notarnicola)

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of a BitWit review which recommended them. Mine seem to be significantly louder than the ones in the review... even at low RPM. Could be a bearing issue, not really sure, but they definitely added volume to my PC. Really no other issue. Can't really speak on behalf of the material quality, they seem sturdy and well made, but I'm no expert. Overall, definitely worth buying at such a low price point.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: More like 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: As it is, they look and work great. Installation and cable management is a bit of a pain due to the configuration of the cords and controller. I think there are now units that combine the power and light control to minimize connections. Not really Pccooler's fault, but I did find it cumbersome. Overall, though, they do exactly what they say they do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooling, quiet, and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: If you're in the market for quality fans then these are some of the best you can get for the price point. 40$ for three fans with the performance of $100+ fans is what you're getting. The Outer ring RGB on both front and back makes it a nice minimal design I really love. I hooked these up to my Masterplus ARGB controller instead of the small one that comes with it and I was really surprised to see that they worked with the software and synced with my other cooler master fans. I also tested them on my MSI MOBO and Aura sync worked well with them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fans at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this fan set in a Cooler Master Q300L. I cut 2, 4-1/2" holes in the front of the case and mounted the fans. Airflow is much better and the GPU stays much cooler now. One thing I really liked about this set is that they can use the standard motherboard RGB headers (I have an ASRock B450M Pro4). There is also a controller if your motherboard does not natively support RGB. These are addressable, so you can get various effects. That's the "Water" effect in my video.
customer_reviews.author: George & Karen C

customer_reviews.title: First RGB fans and seem like really nice fans
customer_reviews.text: So these are my first dive into the RGB fan scene. After seeing a video on them I decided to give them a try. I really like the thin RGB ring so it's not overpowering. They were very easy to install and setup and get the lights colored to how I wanted. I will probably order another 3pack down the road. They have a very sturdy build feel to them. They don't feel like thin cheaply made fans. Now I want to replace my Phanteks case with something that will show them off a bit better
customer_reviews.author: VaderGT

customer_reviews.title: Great product pwm and rgb are amazingly good for price
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome especially for the price the pwm works great the lights work awesome through the provided controller but if you use the rgb from the argb or 12v rgb inputs it works well but does have some minor issues with color very rare. More common is they dont fade brightness well kinda glitchy if going through the argb and 12v rgb input
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: PcCooler Halo: Excellent fans
customer_reviews.text: I was looking around this site for a set of fans that would light up the inside of my pc. With the hot weather, it has been difficult to keep my pc from overheating. So I was essentially looking for something that would keep my pc cool with bright lights. These came at half the price of the ones I was comparing it with. It was easy to install by using the two splitters it came with and all I had to do with them was zip tie them all in the back of my pc. The look is exactly what I was looking for since it doesn’t blind my eyes while gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Bukachi

customer_reviews.title: Best RGB Map-able Fans for $
customer_reviews.text: They hook up to my Asus x570 board and work great with Aurua. My only regret is that i should have bought the colored blades instead of the rings because I want more color in my mostly limited rgb setup. They’re probably the best priced, motherboard controlled fans for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowfax516

customer_reviews.title: Good fans with rgb lights
customer_reviews.text: Fans are good and quiet. They move enough air but i seen better. If you need to push a large amount of air this are not for you. Rgb led are nice and bright. The only thing i dislike its the adapter that it comes to change the light color. Mines was very buggt and will stop working randomly. I ended up changing it to a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose P.

customer_reviews.title: RGB ring on fan messing up less than two months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on August 21, and now 2 months later parts of one of the RGB rings is somehow desynced, displaying a different color than the other two. I had to disconnect the RGB connection so now it's just a regular fan.
customer_reviews.author: sarah edwards

customer_reviews.title: Really good value. Like, really.
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason this has so many good reviews. It works really well. RGB syncs up nicely with Polychrome. Pros: -adjustable fan speed -RGB -the price is significantly less than other similar products -all cables included -RGB controller powered by MOLEX means that you could add RGB to any build -good airflow Cons: -far from silent when blowing hard, but still not uncomfortably loud -no spare cables. I have a spare fan and wanted to put it in a different machine but could not do so practically as the RGB controller needs the splitter cable to connect to the fans. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: infinitytec

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: These fans are incredible. My only complaint with them is that one of the connectors that connect the fans into the hub doesn't snap right in for a tight connection. Not a deal breaker but that's the only -ve I can find on these. Bought these for a new build and overall I am very happy with these. Oh, and they're very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: H Sobers

customer_reviews.title: These are some nice fans
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my PC and was surprised by the quality and outcome. Takes a bit to configure but that's because this package has all the bells and whistles. They give the same output as a more mainstream brand but save half the cost. They can get loud if you have on the highest setting but what do you expect from 5 quality fans that are doing the job. Btw PC has never pushed past medium.
customer_reviews.author: Henry D. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: For the price Yes
customer_reviews.text: Was for a customer build. I have 10 of the TT lights on my system, and they were 129 for 3 ! When I bought them! Fopr the price these do a good job, granted they dont have a lot of LED's like the TT fans do, but they spin up to 2k in fan speed, so they push a lot of air, and are very quiet! Would buy again !
customer_reviews.author: Liz S.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: First impression, the build quality is pretty good. Noise level is decent. It all depends on how fast you run them. These fans are advertised as PWM fans. I don't know if the RGB/Fan hub that came with these fans was defective but i had to get the SilverStone fan hub to get PWM functionality. Also, I would not recommend getting this pack if you are planning to us it with additional single refill version of these fans. You would have to purchase additional RGB adapters and splitters or RGB hub. All that work only find out that there's a color variation between the single refill pack version and the 5 pack.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: They're powerful, quiet, beautiful & well built. You can go 3 pin or 4 pin & the hub can take up to 6 fans. Sleeved cables with very high construction. The remote is awesome & they'll work with any sync software such as Gigabyte, Asus, MSI & ASRock. They're definitely worth every penny. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Da Alpha Supreme

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: These fans are quiet, RGB is nice, but not as "fluid" as Corsair fans, very quiet, almost comparable to Noctua fans, which I have owned before. I bought a 5 pack bundle and had only slight issues with it. Issue: The RGB color controller that comes with it is rather cheap, it keeps losing connection and the lights won't turn on a lot of the times. To get the lights back on, I have to wiggle around the wires around the RGB controller to get the lights back on again. Everything else about the fans are fantastic, to build quality and noise level. Buy em before the price goes up.
customer_reviews.author: Chueyi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in ALL aspects!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are pretty amazing! I am using them as an AF fan and a SP fan and they are working perfect for both! The feel is very nice quality and rigid and the blades are very nice design to move air and stay quiet. The rgb ring on both sides is very equal and very nice color with no hot spots! Love them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fans with ARGB
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with a new MSI mb based build to use with Mystic Light in a Fractal Meshify S2 case. They installed easily and worked with little effort. I bought two sets and was able to link them and connect them to my ARGB hub. Mystic light saw them without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great budget ARGB Fans
customer_reviews.text: This are excellent quality fans with beautiful lighting and all for an affordable price! I'm using them as an intake fan in my case and they push a ton of air and keeps my pc cool. Plus, they're quiet and I dont hear them. The provided ample cable length and extensions to reach a wide area and they have a premium feel because it's braided. The fan also feels very sturdy.it I have the light synced up with Asus Aura and I love the light show with the rainbow preset. Overall very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Unsung hero! Amazing fans! BEST VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best deal in RGB fans! Just put this thibg together and sync'ed PERFECTLY with ASUS SYNC. Nicely lengthed wires actually had me struggling to keep them tidy but the attached video shows all the glory.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Lew

customer_reviews.title: Bright, move alot of air
customer_reviews.text: Instructions suck. If you've put together fans it should be no problem. If it's your first time getting multiple fans, it's gonna be a pain in the butt. Nice fans though and can be controlled by my motherboard's software (steel legend b550)
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: A++++
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated before I get this fans, but the result was amazing. Color was good speed not bad at all, noise level A++++. Please keep in mind the led is like a ring from the outside (back and front) which I like. Easy to install and they have there own controller to control the led if your motherboard doesn't have RGB
customer_reviews.author: Oneplace

customer_reviews.title: Great Addressable RGB fans for the money
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to Bitwit on Youtube for helping me discover this brand. Although he featured the Moonlight fans in a dual system build, I grabbed this Halo Dawn Series fans instead. I am quite surprised by the quality of these fans for the 35.99 price. Just a heads up, but the Addressable RGB header on the motherboard is a 3 pin header. If your system or case doesn't support this, these fans come with a small controller that does. Just grabbed a second set of 3 for my own dual system build.
customer_reviews.author: Korey A. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: More of the same type review
customer_reviews.text: I mean come on. Just buy these if you like the RGB rings. They look glorious, I have 6 (3 front, 2 AIO, 1 back) and it looks outstanding. The reason I got new ones were for the sound, and these are so super quiet. I am extremely happy with my purchase! I just installed them today so we shall see the longevity factor in the future but man, recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat these for the price
customer_reviews.text: These fans were easy to install and had the proper 3 pin rgb header only downside is the controller which is proprietary to this company, would have been nice to have had a more generic controller so i could control all the rgb in my case off of one controller
customer_reviews.author: Sickone

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, feel high quality, and only noisy on max.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the 5 pack for the first PC I ever built alone after watching and reading dozens of reviews comparing different fans. I'm extremely glad I settled on these. I've included a videos of these in action on one of my favorite modes inside of a Cooler Master Q300L.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: MAKE SURE YOUR MOTHERBOARD IS 3PIN LED NOT 4
customer_reviews.text: These fans are super high quality and look absolutely stunning for the price. My only gripe (which is my fault) is that the LED sync only works on motherboards with the 3 pin connectors. I was unaware that there were 2 different connections. I would have returned them for that reason but by the time I realized it we already had 6 fans installed in the case and wired up. For some reason the 5 pack not available on Amazon is 4 pin.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Prichard

customer_reviews.title: Crazy good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price of these I dont know they can be beat. Tons of air flow super quiet good build quality and theres no hotspots with the LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Fleck

customer_reviews.title: extended use review
customer_reviews.text: I didn't review it as soon as i got them, because electrical parts often cause trouble after being used for some time. Bought 3 of them last year mainly for how it looked.. still works the same. good air flow, no noise. No complains. Looks amazing too.
customer_reviews.author: siam.s

customer_reviews.title: Flow Great and Look Great!!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are great! Installed them to get rid of stock case fans. Let me tell you they look great! Works with MSI LED management software. Flow much better than my stock fans. Computer is running much cooler. The leds are bright and have lots of different motion settings. Will be buying a second set!
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually really well made, I was really surprised! Got these to finish up the lighting on my case and I couldn’t be more satisfied. These things “feel” fantastic. I have name brand fans that look and feel cheaper than these. They also connect to what ever kind of set up that you’ve got, 3-pin, 4-pin, or Molex. These were really worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Bell Family

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it if over $50
customer_reviews.text: It is great for people who aren’t serious about cooling and like leds. It can keep nvidia 1070 and ryzen 1800x at acceptable temps under load(room temperature matters if it’s hotter than 85 - 90 degrees it may not perform as well). If you have MSI mystic lights it does not come with a connection for this. If this is ever priced over $50 don’t buy it. If you want LEDs on a budget this is perfect. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Quality AND Affordable
customer_reviews.text: These fans are amazing. They have cool RGB modes using the controller that comes with the 5-in-1 box and can also sync to your motherboard's RGB software controller. The support team quickly responded to my emails and helped me solve my issues. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Safa

customer_reviews.title: I added these to my inventory!
customer_reviews.text: So check out my review on my YouTube Page PC Budget Solutions. But basically I will sum it up as this. It works with addressible RGB, works fine with just molex power, offers better static pressure than the Cooler Master Air Balanced RGB Fans, Lian Li Bora Lite RGB Fans, Fractal Design Venturi Fans, etc. Cooled my 360mm radiator better and even performed well in a case with bad airflow. I highly recommend these fans for anyone on a budget, wants RGB & Quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Head Tech

customer_reviews.title: Good quality fans for relatively cheap price
customer_reviews.text: The lights on the fans look great and they run very quiet compared to my old ones. Highly recommend for anyone looking for good quality fans that aren't outrageously expensive. My only reason for 4 stars is because certain connectors don't match up with the 3 fan set I purchased previously from Pc Cooler and the wires are getting kind of ridiculous to cable manage in the back of my case. Overall though I highly recommend these fans for anyone looking for something relatively cheap that looks nice, runs well, and are of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Cloutier

customer_reviews.title: Had them for 4 months now and they're still fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with this fan since buying them. The colors are very vibrant and nice, the fan is relatively quiet, and they work exactly like they are supposed to for a great price. Only con is that there's a lot of cables attached together so it's a little difficult to find an effective way to install them in your computer. That's only a minor issue though, I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Trang

customer_reviews.title: It took two times, but I'm very happy - Inspect the package contents
customer_reviews.text: The first fans I was sent were clearly repackaged and some items were missing. I had ordered the package through Prime, so I sent it back and got a replacement. The second time, one wire had pulled loose a bit, but I was able to push it back in, which is why I gave it a 4 in terms of quality of materials instead of a 5. Beyond that, the fans work fine and have vivid colors for the RGB. The camera on my phone washed out the colors some in the photo, plus, the photo was taken through a case filter, causing the criss-crossing black lines. In real life, the colors look painted on.
customer_reviews.author: Adept Soul

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but QC problems
customer_reviews.text: two of my three fans work as expected. noise is low, flow rate seems great and the led halos work well. one of my fans clearly has some issues. If the color setting is supposed to be all red, i see a small (1/6th of the ring) is a completely different color. i have set all the color off in my rig because that section is pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 5 pack with a fan/light controller for 50$. The set is great. Easy installation, plenty of length with the wires for route running and cable management. The fans have three-speed settings and on the highest is still not a noise issue for me. Plenty of light settings to match whatever you are feeling. I cannot compare to other fan kits but I have had many different fans in the size range of these and would absolutely compare these to the best I've had. I'd pick these up over and over again without complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love these fans, the directions were a little difficult, but overall once you get it together they work so awesome, they all sync up, there’s tons of different color, lighting, speed, options for these fans and they are good rubber material and my pc not over clocked sits at 53degrees Celsius at long periods of high gaming, which is better then some water coolers
customer_reviews.author: corban baker

customer_reviews.title: Good fans, garbage renote
customer_reviews.text: The fans are great the issue is the 5¢ remote is garbage, the cover is coming off and does not line up with the buttons correctly. For 60usd you expect the remote to work, and this kit is 2 days old! I can not buy goods from a company that lacks even basic quality control.
customer_reviews.author: xvp40

customer_reviews.title: Good fans
customer_reviews.text: Fans are very high quality for the price. They include vibration pads installed, the blades are high quality, and the RGB controls are really nice. It didn’t sync well with my Asus aura very well but the pre-saved options on the controller are very good so I just use those.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Weird Bearing noise coming from One of the fans
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review because I reached out for a warranty exchange and it's been over 2 weeks and haven't gotten a response. I purchased the Fans back in Dec 2019 basically Jan. They look great but one sounds terrible at times. I have checked and verify nothing is blocking or coming into contact with the fan and the sound goes away after a while but comes back randomly. Basically if you purchase the fans they will look great but be warned the bearings may not last.
customer_reviews.author: Hector G.

customer_reviews.title: RGB Died after 2 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: RGB LEDs died after two week of use. Fans still push air though. I'd be careful and shell out the extra $$$ for a quality brand. Fans were great when they work! I couldnt get the ARGB to work, but the RGB did work with Mystic Light. The lighting modes are neat, but they're really laggy on slow settings. I'd stick with using the lighting modes on the Hub instead of your Motherboard's software, they seem to be more diverse and customizable., and ARGB-like.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fans for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price I didnt expect much but I gotta say the material build is great. The LEDs are bright and clean. I dont have an rgb header on my mb so I'm stuck using the built in control which works very well. The air flow these produce are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: vbender

customer_reviews.title: Best value to performance fans
customer_reviews.text: These fans are great. I was really looking to make my RGB effects a little more subtle, and these do the trick. The overall design of thme is outstanding and visually, they are awesome. Performance wise, I use them to discharge air out of my case and they get the job done and stay quite while doing it. They are build very nicely and have good weight to them (they dont feel cheap at all). For 36 bucks, you can't pass these up.
customer_reviews.author: GregBoz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty quiet and just the right brightness.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m very happy with this purchase. These just look slick compared to the fully lite LED fans. I wanted to add a picture to show clean it all looks, but my iPhones camera makes the fans look dull and the case look like it’s completely lite up. Sound haven’t been an issues either. There’s not a special super quiet fan, but I honesty barley hear them. Really happy with how it all came together.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Get the 5-1 pack
customer_reviews.text: This review is more about the "hub" than the fans themselves. I bought 2 of these 3 packs. My motherboard is an older one and doesn't have argb headers, which from what comes with this pack you would think wouldn't be a problem. The main issue is the hub. It only supports 3 fans, there is no possible way to daisy chain them together without having to buy a seperate rgb hub. The 5-1 comes with a hub that supports up to 8 fans. Better off getting that and maybe a 3 pack or a single fan depending on how many today rgb headers you need. If you only need 3 fans then this would be fine
customer_reviews.author: carlos s.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive. And affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with these fans. I wanted rgb, but nothing to overpowering. They are completely compatible with my Aorus B450m motherboard so I didn't need to install the remote. No complaints on fan noise either. Super quiet. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Manri Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but didn't work on my computer
customer_reviews.text: This unfortunately did not work on my old motherboard. I wasn't sure if it's just the motherboard or the fans not being compatible but I just returned them and got an external fan in the meantime (til I can get a new motherboard, and fully upgrade my pc). The lights turned on but the fans refused to spin.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Good quiet fans if you leave them at low speed.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fans. The quality on these are very solid and the fans are very quiet if you leave it at low fan speed. Once you go to med or high, it can get loud. At low speed these are almost as quiet as my noctua fans, while moving a very good amount of air. I have these on my 360mm rad and they're doing pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ramen

customer_reviews.title: 5v leds!!! Not 12v!!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are 5v and not 12v. I didnt do enough research before I bought them. There are so many extra plugs, installing them were a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Alex green

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but EXTREMELY LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale for $30 thinking I got myself a good savings over the Corsair RGB fans. Boy was I wrong. These things are incredibly loud and easily the loudest things in my case. I run them at 50% and they make such an awful jet engine sound. At 100%, it sounds awful and can even hear it through my headphones. Highly recommend NOT getting these. In addition, they provide poor airflow and as other reviewers have mentioned, you really need to crank them up to get them to push any significant air.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: 2 fans arrived dead, hub only works with sync remote does nothing, I dont really plan on using the remote as it syncs with my m/b but its unfortunate that only 50% of my products work as described. I will not purchase this brand again. And a month later, customer service is still harassing me to change my review for sub par goods.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: Fans were very strong and had a high CFM so it was keeping the temperatures down. Only downside is that it was audible at max but they moved a lot of air so it was a 50-50 on if it matters to you that much. For me it does not and the fans worked great. Couldnt get AURA sync on my mobo but I found a way to utilize the box instead. Great aftermarket fans.
customer_reviews.author: Hmb2k14

customer_reviews.title: Great VALUE, Great product
customer_reviews.text: I think I can sum up these fans in a few short statements. Great quality! Great value! whisper quiet! I bought the first box thinking I would just try a box of inexpensive RGB fans for a lark with a new Gaming PC I was building. They worked so well I replaced my CPU radiator cooling fans with these. Colors are vibrant, fans are well built and super quiet. liked them so much I just bought another box.
customer_reviews.author: MltryMan66

product_meta.title: Pccooler 120mm Case Fan Dawn Series, 3M120HALO LED RGB Silent Fans - Advanced Lighting Customizations with 7 Colors&10 Lighting Modes - PWM High Performance Cooling Fan for PC Case Computer Fan
feature_bullets: 【Intelligent Speed Control】3 ×120mm full function PWM silent fans adopt wolf claw bionic design helps wind diversion to increase air convection efficiency and greatly improve heat dissipation. Stable operation and reduce noise. The intelligent temperature control mute module controls the speed at 1000~2000±10% RPM.

【Multi-mode Light Effect】Monochrome glow, monochrome change and rainbow effect.Each fan is equipped with 8 ARGB LED beads, 6 colors and 10 light effect modes.One click to change the RGB color.Provide complete lighting for your computer.Through the control box or motherboard software control to create your own unique case lighting effects.

【Motherboard Synchronization & Controller】The motherboard software synchronization mode, build your own light effect control system. Support ASUS, Gigabyte, MSI main software synchronization control (Gigabyte motherboards need RGB adapter cable/includeded）. Support FRGB controller and FRGB SYNC motherboard (+5V/3 PIN pin) software to synchronize two lighting control methods.

【Shockproof Design】The fan frame is fixed on both sides with 8 pieces of shock absorbing rubber pads. The rubber soft material which is not easy to peel off has good shock absorbing effect, which can make the internal operation of the computer case stably and reduce the noise output between the fan and the computer case.

【Top Bearing Technology】 Hydraulic bearing with longer service life to reduce noise and improve heat dissipation efficiency. Lifetime 30,000 Hrs.Suitable for CPU cooler and support 120/240/360 mm liquid cooler.(case /GPU etc）

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars991 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
